translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of the World
at the foot of the Bodhi tree,
with a confident mind, full of joy,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of holding up the ukke.
How welcome it was for me,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Tiṇukkadhāri recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tiṇukkadhāriyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Tiṇukkadhāriyattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā tiṇukkadhāriyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽tiṇukkadhāriya therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Birth Story of the Elder Tiṇukkadhāri is the fourth.
